title: Indian cricket: BCCI takes a big step; to give pay hike to women domestic players
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has approved a major pay hike for India‚Äôs women domestic cricketers, more than doubling match fees across senior and junior levels. Senior players will now earn up to Rs 50,000 per day. The decision follows India‚Äôs Women‚Äôs ODI World Cup win.

title: India-NZ FTA: Faced with Trump tariffs, why new trade deals are important - explained
content: India and New Zealand have finalized a Free Trade Agreement, promising duty-free entry for Indian goods and $20 billion in New Zealand investments over 15 years. The pact aims to double bilateral trade within five years, though New Zealand's foreign minister expressed opposition, deeming it 'neither free nor fair'.

title: Meta‚Äôs most-famous employee to students: Do not study computer; focus on core subjects
content: AI pioneer Yann LeCun advises computer science students to prioritize foundational subjects like math and physics over trendy technology courses. He argues that a strong grasp of core principles, often found in engineering disciplines, is crucial for long-term adaptability in the rapidly evolving tech landscape.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli spotted at Mumbai airport; returns to Vijay Hazare Trophy
content: Former India captain Virat Kohli is set to play for Delhi in the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy, marking a return to domestic cricket.  His presence, alongside experienced players like Ishant Sharma and Navdeep Saini, adds significant buzz to Delhi's campaign. Kohli enters the tournament in strong ODI form, aiming to reconnect with the domestic grind and lead by example.

title: K'taka honour killing: Pregnant woman beaten to death over inter-caste marriage; 3 held
content: A 20-year-old woman, Manya Patil, has died from injuries sustained in an alleged honour killing in Dharwad. Three individuals, identified as Prakash, Veeran, and Arun, have been arrested for the assault, which reportedly involved a pipe. Manya's mother-in-law, father-in-law, and sister also suffered injuries during the incident. Investigations are continuing.

title: Retreat from LLMs: Salesforce pivots to deterministic AI; shift may impact enterprises
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, as acknowledged by executives. The company is shifting towards more predictable 'deterministic' automation in its Agentforce product, aiming to eliminate AI's inherent randomness.

title: 'The real luxury': Chahal's post goes viral; wins hearts
content: Yuzvendra Chahal went viral after sharing an emotional post about buying a new BMW Z4 M40i with his parents, as he called their presence ‚Äúthe real luxury.‚Äù Retained by Punjab Kings for IPL 2026, Chahal has been out of India‚Äôs plans since 2023. He recently missed the SMAT final due to dengue and chikungunya, but the spinner promised a strong return.

title: After cutting Amazon stake: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife donates billions in 2025; 186 groups benefit
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits, marking her largest annual giveaway. This significant philanthropic effort, detailed on her website Yield Giving, continues her focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, with substantial contributions to institutions like Howard University and the UNCF.

title: Men, are you ignoring breast cancer symptoms? Doctors share 4 tips to prevent it
content: Men, breast cancer is a reality, not just a woman's disease. Rare but serious, it often goes undiagnosed due to lack of awareness, leading to advanced stages. Genetic factors like BRCA mutations, age and lifestyle are key risks. Early detection through self-exams and prompt medical consultation significantly improves outcomes. Understanding symptoms and seeking care is vital for all.

title: Christmas 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages & quotes to share
content: As Christmas approaches, the festive spirit is palpable with decorations and a shopping frenzy. The article offers a curated collection of around 60 messages for friends, family, and colleagues, categorized into short, moving, spiritual, cheerful, and reflective wishes. These greetings aim to spread joy, love, and gratitude during the holiday season, encouraging connection and cherished moments.

title: Star Wars: Is Russia targeting Musk‚Äôs Starlink? Nato makes explosive claim
content: Nato intelligence suggests Russia is developing a novel anti-satellite weapon designed to release thousands of tiny metal pellets, potentially disabling multiple satellites, including Ukraine's vital Starlink constellation. This "zone-effect" weapon could create widespread, uncontrollable space debris, posing a significant threat to all orbital assets. Experts debate its practicality and potential repercussions.

title: Who is Aaron Rodgers‚Äô wife Brittani? Inside the Steelers QB‚Äôs marriage mystery
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.

title: Vince & Linda McMahon net worth 2025: WWE earnings & business success
content: Wrestling titans Vince and Linda McMahon boast a $3.2 billion net worth in 2025, largely from their WWE empire and TKO Group Holdings shares. Vince's legacy in transforming wrestling is undeniable, while Linda also carved a significant business and political path. Despite recent legal challenges for Vince, their financial success endures.

title: Christen Goff reveals how motherhood transformed the Goffs‚Äô family homes
content: Christen Goff is navigating motherhood by creating two distinct yet personal homes in Los Angeles and Michigan for her and daughter Romy.  She thoughtfully designs each space to reflect its location and their evolving family identity.  Despite the challenges of a newborn and dual residences, Christen finds joy and belonging in this new chapter.

title: 'People say MS Dhoni hurt my career': Ex-India cricketer's honest take goes viral - watch
content: Spinner Amit Mishra reflects positively on his relationship with former captain MS Dhoni, refuting claims that Dhoni hindered his career. Mishra credits Dhoni for his consistent comebacks and support, recalling a specific instance where Dhoni's advice led to a game-changing five-wicket haul. He emphasizes Dhoni's understanding of the game and his role in maximizing opportunities.

title: 'People will forget': Ex-India captain‚Äôs blunt warning to Sanju Samson
content: Sanju Samson's T20 World Cup selection is lauded by former selector Srikkanth, who urges him to convert starts into big scores. Samson seized his opportunity after a period out, while Shubman Gill's struggles and injury led to his omission. Srikkanth also highlighted India's formidable batting, calling it "intimidating and devastating."

title: 'I challenge Mamata': Suspended TMC MLA floats new party; Bengal CM hits back
content: Humayun Kabir, a West Bengal MLA, has launched his new political party, the Janata Unnayan Party. This move follows his suspension from the Trinamool Congress. Kabir plans to contest the 2026 West Bengal assembly elections. He aims to challenge Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and has declared his intention to contest from two seats in Murshidabad

title: Ashes: Should McCullum and Stokes be sacked? Strauss opens up
content: Andrew Strauss says sacking Ben Stokes or Brendon McCullum will not solve England‚Äôs repeated Ashes failures in Australia. The former captain, England‚Äôs last Ashes winner Down Under, believes deeper structural changes are needed. With England 3-0 down again, Strauss warned against knee-jerk reactions and urged reforms to fix a long-standing system problem.

title: Vivek Oberoi clarifies SRK stardom comment after backlash
content: Vivek Oberoi clarified his recent controversial comment about Shah Rukh Khan's future relevance, stating his words were taken out of context. He emphasized that while superstardom is transient, good deeds and lasting legacies endure, drawing parallels with historical figures and contemporary stars. Oberoi reiterated his deep admiration and respect for SRK, highlighting their decades-long positive relationship.

title: Aaron Rodgers‚Äô heartfelt words about his wife deepen private life mystery
content: Aaron Rodgers has confirmed he is married but continues to keep his wife, Brittani, completely out of the public eye. His heartfelt comments describing her as ‚Äúincredible‚Äù have fueled curiosity, especially with no photos or appearances to confirm her identity. Rodgers‚Äô rare openness highlights a deeply private love story unfolding away from the spotlight.

title: B'desh to scale back diplomatic presence in India? What its FM said
content: The ministry of external affairs (MEA) on Saturday had said that about 20-25 youths gathered in front of the Bangladesh High Commission in New Delhi on Saturday and raised slogans, protesting the "horrendous killing" of Dipu Chandra Das, 25, who was lynched to death by a mob in Mymensingh on Thursday.

title: Maharashtra local body polls: Mahayuti sweeps, Congress hits roadblocks in Vidarbha
content: BJP emerged as the single largest party in Maharashtra's local body polls, securing 117 president posts and doubling its councillors since 2017. Despite challenges, the Mahayuti alliance, including Shiv Sena and NCP factions, celebrated a significant win, seen as a precursor to upcoming municipal corporation elections.

title: CBSE announces orientation programme on entrance exams for faculties in UP
content: CBSE has rescheduled its Orientation Programme on Entrance Exams and Career Pathways for Principals and Counsellors in Shahjahanpur, Uttar Pradesh. Originally postponed due to rising river levels, the offline event will now take place on December 30, 2025, at Seth M. R. Jaipuria School. The initiative aims to bolster career guidance and align school practices with NEP 2020.

title: U19 Asia Cup: Pak PM Sharif announces reward for winners; each player to get PKR 10 million
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif announced a 10 million Pakistani rupees cash award for each U19 player after Pakistan thrashed India by 191 runs to win the U19 Asia Cup. Sameer Minhas starred with a brilliant 172, while Pakistan‚Äôs pacers dominated. Coaches and players praised teamwork, preparation, and collective effort behind the title win.

title: 'No new mining': Amid uproar, Centre clarifies Aravalli order; defends new definition
content: Speaking on the Supreme Court's acceptance of the "new definition" of Aravalli, the minister said: "The ruling recognises and endorses the Government of India‚Äôs sustained efforts to protect the Aravalli range through scientific assessment, strict safeguards and initiatives such as the Aravalli Green Wall Project." Yadav explained that the Aravali range comprises all landforms located within 500 metres of two adjoining hills with a height of 100 metres or more.

title: 'England have had a cockiness': Vaughan rips into Stokes & team; Ashes hammering the trigger
content: England‚Äôs Ashes 2025‚Äì26 campaign ended in disaster as Australia sealed a 3-0 lead within 11 days. Michael Vaughan criticised Ben Stokes‚Äô side for their failed approach, calling the tour ‚Äúhumbling.‚Äù Despite strong efforts from Stokes and Archer, England fell short chasing 435, with Australia dominating throughout and retaining the Ashes comfortably.

title: Life under the river: How the east‚Äìwest metro is redrawing Kolkata‚Äôs daily map
content: Kolkata's new East-West Metro, the Green Line, has revolutionized city travel with its groundbreaking underwater tunnel beneath the Hooghly River. This engineering marvel drastically cuts commute times between Salt Lake and Howrah, offering comfort and reliability. The line is already transforming daily life, easing congestion and connecting twin cities like never before.

title: On this day: Rohit Sharma stamped his authority with 35-ball T20I hundred; set new record
content: Eight years ago today, Rohit Sharma etched his name in T20I history by smashing a joint-fastest century off just 35 balls against Sri Lanka in Indore. This explosive innings, featuring 12 boundaries and 10 sixes, was a highlight of his stellar career before retiring after India's 2024 T20 World Cup triumph.

title: BrahMos and beyond: How UP is becoming India‚Äôs defence capital
content: India's supersonic prowess is taking flight from Lucknow with the inauguration of a state-of-the-art BrahMos Aerospace Integration and Testing Facility. This 200-acre complex is set to become the epicentre for producing the formidable BrahMos cruise missile, catering to surging domestic and international demand, including significant export orders.

title: Dhurandhar‚Äô box office day 18: Ranveer Singh-starrer slows after Rs 550 cr mark
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, becoming the biggest second-weekend grosser of all time with Rs 253 crore collected in its second week. The film has now amassed Rs 558.01 crore in India, showing strong performance even into its third weekend.

title: ‚ÄòWon‚Äôt let them become communal labs‚Äô: Why Christmas row erupted in Kerala schools
content: Kerala's Education Minister V. Sivankutty has warned private schools against blocking Christmas celebrations, citing concerns of divisive religious models. He emphasized that schools should foster secular values and unity among students, vowing strict action against institutions promoting narrow communal interests. The minister's remarks followed reports of some schools cancelling festivities.

title: 'Desh ke andar do namune hai': Yogi's veiled swipe at Akhilesh, Rahul; SP chief hits back
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath targeted Akhilesh Yadav and Rahul Gandhi, calling them "two specimens" who flee the country during discussions. He denied deaths from codeine syrup, stating action will be taken under the NDPS Act and linking the biggest wholesaler to the SP's tenure. Akhilesh Yadav criticized the personal attacks and alleged the racket originated from the Prime Minister's constituency.

title: Bangladesh unrest: After Osman Hadi, another youth leader shot in head
content: Days after the killing of youth leader Sharif Osman Bin Hadi, another prominent youth leader, Motaleb Sikdar, was shot in head on Monday. He was taken to hospital in critical condition. This incident escalates concerns over political violence amidst heightened tensions following Hadi's death, which sparked widespread protests demanding justice.

title: Stock market today: Sensex up over 600 points - top reasons for rally
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Monday extending gains from the last trading session. While Nifty50 went above 26,150, BSE Sensex was up over 600 points.

title: 'A big hug from me': Mandhana touches hearts while replying to Kashmiri fan
content: Smriti Mandhana touched hearts by replying to a young Kashmiri fan after filmmaker Kabir Khan shared her story from Aru Valley. Soon after, Mandhana made history in the first T20I against Sri Lanka by becoming the first Indian woman to score 4,000 T20I runs, highlighting her class on and off the field.

title: Aamir Khan: 25 Years of box office reinvention and risks
content: Aamir Khan, Bollywood's 'Mr Perfectionist', has carved a unique path over 25 years, marked by groundbreaking blockbusters like 'Dangal' and '3 Idiots', alongside notable flops. His career, a blend of artistic risks and commercial success, showcases a filmmaker's vision within an actor's persona. Despite recent setbacks, his influence as a content driver remains significant.

title: Another husband murder in UP: Man hacked to death by wife, her lovers; head missing
content: A chilling murder in Chandausi has shocked residents after a woman allegedly conspired with her lovers to kill her husband. Rahul, a shoe trader, was brutally dismembered, with body parts found scattered. His wife, Ruby, initially reported him missing, but inconsistencies led to her detention along with two others. Evidence suggests the murder occurred at their home.

title: 'If you're a good team, you don't need an Impact Player': Sam Curran
content: England all-rounder Sam Curran is in scintillating form for Desert Vipers in ILT20, leading the run charts and contributing with crucial wickets.  He credits team continuity and enjoyable conditions for their success.  With the T20 World Cup looming, Curran's stellar performances put him firmly in the spotlight, aiming for trophies and continued enjoyment of the sport.

title: IPL 2026: R Ashwin calls Virat Kohli's new teammate an 'absolute steal by RCB'
content: New Zealand pacer Jacob Duffy achieved a historic five-wicket haul in the final Test against the West Indies, securing a series victory. His performance also saw him surpass Richard Hadlee's record for most wickets in a calendar year for New Zealand. Duffy's exceptional 2025 form across formats has earned him high praise.

content: Michigan interim coach Biff Poggi described the program as a "malfunctioning organization" after a series of high-profile scandals, one he hopes to "fix" if he becomes the team's permanent coach.

title: Steelers' Metcalf shoves fan during game in Detroit
content: Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf was involved in an altercation with a fan at Ford Field during the second quarter of Sunday's 29-24 win over the Detroit Lions.

title: Back injury forces Ravens' Jackson from SNF loss
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson left Sunday night's game against the Patriots late in the first half because of a back injury. He said he hopes to play Saturday at Green Bay but will first have an MRI on Monday.

title: Lions own loss after late OPI calls: 'It's on us'
content: The Detroit Lions owned their big loss after late offensive pass interference calls, with coach Dan Campbell saying, "It's on us."

title: Maye rallies Pats after last week's 'wake-up call'
content: A week after failing to lead a winning drive against Buffalo, Patriots QB Drake Maye was given the same opportunity Sunday night at Baltimore -- and this time he delivered one of the signature performances of his career to clinch a playoff spot.

title: Sources: Cardinals trade Contreras to Red Sox
content: The Red Sox have acquired first baseman Willson Contreras from the Cardinals in exchange for right-hander Hunter Dobbins and additional pitching, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Chiefs fear Minshew suffered ACL tear
content: One week after losing starter Patrick Mahomes to an ACL tear, Chiefs quarterback Gardner Minshew is feared to also have suffered a torn ACL, sources told ESPN.

content: The fourth-generation Aggie helped Texas A&M win its first volleyball title in a most improbable fashion.

title: PSU signs pact with France‚Äôs Safran group to make advanced defence systems in India
content: India Optel and Safran will jointly manufacture two key systems widely used in artillery guns, missiles, radars, anti-drone applications; Defence Ministry says the venture will reduce dependency on imports

title: Forests cannot be used for non-forestry purposes, including agriculture: Supreme Court
content: Bench upholds appeal filed by Karnataka government against Gandhi Jeevan Collective Farming Cooperative Society, which wanted extension of lease on 134 acres of forest, which had been illegally granted to them for cultivation

content: The Bench says the petitioner failed to¬†establish¬†any statutory basis for the relief¬†sought and the petition lacked merit

title: As nurses continue protest, Health Minister Ma. Subramanian offers 723 new posts
content: Despite the offer from the government, nurses affiliated to the Tamil Nadu Nurses Empowerment Association have decided to continue their protest, demanding more negotiations

title: Watch: Pregnant woman killed in suspected honour attack in Karnataka
content: A 19-year-old pregnant woman was brutally attacked in Inam Veerapur village, Karnataka, in a suspected honour killing, days after returning to her village following an inter-caste marriage. Her husband and in-laws were also injured.

title: From healthy cakes to Secret Santa, Bengaluru shines with Christmas cheer
content: While demand for items like plum cakes and rum balls¬†remain¬†high across the markets, vegan cake varieties like dates, walnut and almond cakes¬†are also picking up, apart from eggless and wineless cakes, say shopkeepers

title: VB-G RAM G Act is not demolition of MGNREGA but overdue repair: BJP rebuts Sonia Gandhi's allegations
content: The Congress leader, in an article titled ‚ÄòThe bulldozed demolition of MGNREGA‚Äô, had said the "death" of MGNREGA is a collective failure. Criticising her over the article, BJP IT department head Amit Malviya said the article reads less like a serious engagement with law or data and more like a flight of political fancy.

content: Prudent Electoral Trust¬†was the top donor, disbursing ‚Çπ2,668 crore¬†to 15 parties in the last fiscal; other sources include individuals, corporates, and institutions donating directly

title: Bengaluru metro network to reach 175 km by December 2027: D.K. Shivakumar
content: A major highlight of the announcement was the long-pending Phase 3 of Namma Metro finally moving into the execution stage

title: BLOs protest in Kolkata against fresh workload, clash with police
content: They have been directed to go door to door again to correct discrepancies, deliver notices regarding hearings

content: Think releases report titled ‚ÄòInternationalisation of Higher Education in India: Prospects, Potential, and Policy Recommendations‚Äô, which recommends 22 such policy interventions in order to deal with the ‚Äòimbalance between inbound and outbound student mobility‚Äô

title: 2.12 Lakh New PUCs Issued In 4 Days As Delhi Cracks Down Under GRAP-IV
content: More than 2.12 lakh new PUC certificates were issued following the strict implementation of GRAP-IV measures over the past four days, Delhi Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said on Monday.

title: Wife Claimed Husband Died In Washroom. Injuries Reveal Chilling Murder Plot
content: A 36-year-old woman and her paramour were among three persons arrested here for allegedly killing the woman's husband, who worked as a logistics manager at a private university, police said on Monday.

title: Bangladesh Temporarily Suspends Consular, Visa Services At High Commission In Delhi
content: The Bangladesh High Commission in New Delhi said on Monday that all consular and visa services have been temporarily suspended until further notice.

title: Singer Harassed While Performing 'Jago Maa'. What Is The Song All About?
content: Bengali singer Lagnajita Chakraborty was allegedly harassed for performing the song "Jago Maa" during a concert on Saturday, sparking widespread criticism.

title: Ambuja Cements Board Approves Merger Of Cement Maker ACC, Orient Cement
content: The board of Adani group firm Ambuja Cements on Monday approved the amalgamation of subsidiaries ACC Ltd and Orient Cement with the company to create a pan-India cement powerhouse.

title: Woman Strangled To Death In Delhi, Case Filed Against Missing Husband: Cops
content: A 30-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death in west Delhi's Mohan Garden area, with police registering a murder case against her husband after the postmortem examination ruled out suicide, an official said on Monday.

title: UP's Samajwadi Party's Biggest Donation Came From 1,000 km Away In Bengal
content: Recent contribution data filed by the Samajwadi Party (SP) with the Election Commission of India (ECI) shows that a significant share of its funding is coming from West Bengal, nearly 1,000 kilometres away.

title: Animals Bear Brunt As Delhi Air Pollution Shows No Signs Of Abatement
content: As Delhi-NCR's toxic air sparks warnings for children, the elderly and those with respiratory illness, veterinarians and animal welfare groups are flagging a quieter crisis unfolding among pets and stray animals.

title: Centre Defends Top Court's Aravalli Order Amid Mining Fears
content: As controversy swirls around the Supreme Court-approved redefinition of the Aravalli hills, Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav insisted that the core objective is to prepare a core objective is to prepare a "management plan for sustainable mining".

title: Denmark Warns US To Respect Its Sovereignty As Trump Names Greenland Envoy
content: Denmark warned the United States Monday to respect its sovereignty after President Donald Trump appointed a special envoy to Greenland, the Danish autonomous territory Trump has threatened to annex.

title: Taiwan Knife, Smoke Grenade Attack Suspect Planned Assault For Over 1 Year
content: The suspect in a deadly knife and grenade attack that left three dead and 11 wounded in Taiwan's capital meticulously planned the assault for more than a year, police said Monday.

title: Curfew Declared After Violence Breaks Out In Assam's West Karbi Anglong Area
content: At least three people and a paramilitary personnel were injured as the situation in Assam's West Karbi Anglong district turned highly volatile on Monday as protests over alleged encroachment on protected tribal lands escalated into violence.

title: Over 500 Flights Delayed At Delhi Airport Due To Bad Weather, Low Visibility
content: More than 500 flights were delayed, and at least 14 flights were cancelled at the Delhi airport due to bad weather and low visibility conditions.

title: Toxic Haze Hangs Over Delhi As 12 Stations Log 'Severe' Air Quality
content: A thick grey haze hung over the capital on Monday while the air quality settled in the 'very poor' category, with the 24-hour average AQI recorded at 373.

title: 'Congress Insiders Involved In 2013 Maoist Attack': JP Nadda's Big Claim
content: In a sharp attack on Congress, BJP president JP Nadda on Monday alleged that some insiders in the party were involved in facilitating the 2013 Jhiram Ghati Maoist attack, which led to the killing of state Congress leaders.

title: "Tourist Party": Uddhav Sena Leader Slams Congress Ahead Of Mumbai Polls
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) spokesperson Anand Dubey took a swipe at the Congress, calling it a "tourist party" and asserting that it holds little relevance in the upcoming BMC elections.

title: Video: Ukrainian Drone 'Locks In' On Russian Soldier On Horse, Blast Follows
content: This year, drones have emerged as a crucial tool on the battlefield, especially for Ukraine. Their use has helped Kyiv hold its ground against Russian forces despite shortages in infantry.

title: BJP Leader's "Learn Hindi" Warning To African Man, Then A Clarification
content: A BJP councillor was seen threatening an African national to learn Hindi within a month or else he would not be allowed inside a public park where he teaches football in Delhi.

title: Uber, Ola Buses, Big EV Push: What Delhi May Do To Curb Air Pollution
content: As congestion and pollution continue to choke the national capital, the Delhi government is considering a combination of tougher enforcement and incentives for cleaner mobility.

title: Vice President advises defence accounts trainees to focus on last-mile delivery
content: Civil servants will play a pivotal role in achieving the ambitious goal of becoming a Viksit Bharat by 2047, the vice president said

title: Congress demands Railway Minister‚Äôs resignation over train fare hike
content: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar said that the fare had been hiked twice since June 2024 when the Narendra Modi government came to power for the third time. The fares had gone up by 107% in the last 10 years, he said

title: District-wise plan to demarcate mining areas in Aravalli Range in the works: Environment Minister
content: Under fire from environmental activists and a social media storm alleging that vast tracts of the Aravalli Range may be opened for mining, Bhupender Yadav stressed that no new mining licenses would be awarded

title: CPI(M) MP terms Priyanka Gandhi Vadra‚Äôs presence at Speaker‚Äôs tea party unfortunate

title: UDF set to head Alappuzha municipal council with Independent‚Äôs support

title: Bihar witnesses decline in number of major criminal cases

title: 'Tis the szn': Chargers troll Cowboys multiple times after victory
content: the Los Angeles Chargers beat the Dallas Cowboys 34-17 on the road . it's their fourth straight win in a row . the team edited a clip from the 2004 film "The Polar Express" the conductor punches an "L" on a ticket for the cowboys.

title: Wetzel: Is this the last straw for NCAA enforcement?
content: Jeremy Pruitt coached the Vols from 2018 to '20 . he was fired after the school uncovered recruiting violations . in 2023, the NCAA's committee on infractions concluded the program committed 18 Level I violations - mostly related to paying prospects and their families .

title: 'He just took over': How Mark Fletcher became the engine powering Miami's run
content: Shannon Dawson's game plan was to throw the kitchen sink at Texas A&M . he would run every twist on every play he could imagine until something broke . the score was tied at 3 and both offenses had traded blows in a battle of attrition .

title: After years away, Sunderland's Premier League return has revived the club and its city
content: sunderland beat Newcastle 1-0 in the first premier league game in nearly a decade . it was the longest postmatch celebration of the season . the team gathered for an impromptu photo, infuriating supporters and delighting their own .

title: From Lane Kiffin to Pat Fitzgerald, we rank every FBS coaching hire
content: former Nebraska quarterback Scott Frost returned to Lincoln to save a flailing cornhuskers program . he went 16-31 and was fired early in his fifth season . former Ohio State player and longtime Buckeyes assistant Luke Fickell took the Wisconsin head coaching job .

title: Our reporters make sense of Week 16: Statement wins for Patriots, Jaguars, Panthers, Steelers, Bears
content: a game between the Rams and the Seahawks began with a Thursday night contest . the game was the first of the season, as the Bears beat the Packers . in the early window, the Panthers moved into first place in the NFC South .

title: Playoff picture projections: Updated odds for every team trying to reach the postseason
content: live ESPN Analytics' live playoff chances provide each team's postseason likelihood at any given moment . the projected final standings will update regularly, and we're also tracking tight postseason races and the projected 2026 draft order for non-playoff teams . see how things stack up in both conferences throughout every game for rest of the regular season .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: MLB offseason grades: Red Sox deal for Contreras, White Sox land Murakami
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .
